qas.question: In addition to the southern and eastern sections of Southampton, what other section has local train service?
What company operates Southampton's local train service?
What organization announced plans for rail expansion in Southampton in July of 2009?
In what year did a proposal to expand light rail service to Portsmouth and Gosport fail?
What's the current destination of the freight-only line the Hampshire County Council wants to use to expand passenger service?

context: Local train services operate in the <a0_0>central<a0_0/>, southern and eastern sections of the city and are operated by <a1_0>South West Trains<a1_0/>, with stations at Swaythling, St Denys, Millbrook, Redbridge, Bitterne, Sholing and Woolston. Plans were announced by <a2_0>Hampshire County Council<a2_0/> in July 2009 for the introduction of tram-train running from Hythe (on what is now a freight-only line to <a4_0>Fawley<a4_0/>) via Totton to Southampton Central Station and on to Fareham via St. Denys, and Swanwick. The proposal follows a failed plan to bring light rail to the Portsmouth and Gosport areas in <a3_0>2005<a3_0/>.
